Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2017 03:25PM lemonee wrote: Thank you so much for the information. I really do wish I knew the BIRADS score, but maybe it's best if I don't know until the biopsy and consultation. I go back and forth between feeling calm and positive to be scared and anxious.
Posts.Title: Suspicious mass - having biopsy -worried lemonee KBeee

Posts.Content: Dec 14, 2017 04:31PM lemonee wrote: I had my consultation and biopsy today. The surgeon said he's pretty sure it's malignant. I asked if he thought it could be early stage and he said that he thinks from the size it's been there for a while. The biopsy was way less scary than I expected. I'll get my results next Tuesday and have set up my appointment for the treatment plan. I just feel numb and am so scared that I waited too long to get this checked. I'm so worried that it might be late stage.

Posts.Title: Suspicious mass - having biopsy -worried lemonee KBeee

Posts.Content: lemonee wrote: Hello all. I've been having a pinching/burning pain in one breast for a long time,but since I'm in my late 40s I thought it was probably due to hormonal changes from perimenopause. Then I found a lump and went for an examination. I was very negligent and hadn't had an exam for 8 years before that. The gynecologist sent me for a diagnostic mammogram and an ultrasound. Before leaving, I was told I would have my results in 48-72 hours. Instead, within 10 minutes of leaving the office, I got a call from my doctor's office saying the radiologist called and said I had a "grape-sized suspicious mass" and that they set up an appointment for the next week for an ultrasound-guided biopsy and breast-care consultation with the radiologist and surgeon. I haven't gotten the official results of the mammogram/ultrasound and I'm not sure if I will get them before going for the biopsy this coming Thursday. I just don't know how worried I should be... Dx 12/14/2017, IDC, Left, 5cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 3, ER-/PR+, HER2- Chemotherapy 1/16/2018 Adriamycin (doxorubicin), Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxol (paclitaxel) Surgery 7/19/2018 Mastectomy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Radiation Therapy 8/22/2018 Whole-breast: Breast, Lymph nodes, Chest wall Log in to post a reply

I hope all your test results were good ones. Wishing you the best!

Posts.Content: Dec 19, 2017 03:34AM lemonee wrote: It made me so sad to read your original post, but at the same time, it made me feel less alone. I definitely share similar feelings. For me, those feelings are the main reason I let years go between my exams, and now I find myself in this position.
Posts.Title: Abuse Survivor Struggling With Testing DagnyT DagnyT

Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2017 12:39AM lemonee wrote: I was very worried about mine too, and it went completely without a hitch. No pain. The pressure and clicking didn't bother me at all. I wore ice packs pretty much nonstop for two days or so. I have had bruising and soreness, but my mass was already painful to begin with. The technician and radiologist were great. They casually talked to me about the weather and the upcoming holidays all the way through, along with explaining every step. I hope you have a smooth experience too. One tip: I don't like needles or anything invasive, so I always make sure to avert my eyes during procedures of any type. Ignorance is bliss in those situations for me. Lol
